message:
The English Academy of St. Xavier's College, Kolkata presents their annual lit-fest Literaria 2016. The following are online events :
1. Meme'sis (the meme making competition)
2. Striptacular (comic-strip creations)
3. Doodlebug (the doodle competition for the free-flowing, felt-tip pen happy)
4. Lens and Lensibility (the photography competition, but we appreciate Austen too)
5. Dress the Digest (calling all graphics geeks to show off their magazine designs)
6. Jump Cut (a film making project and competition for all the cinephiles out there)

So, sign up for the event which you feel is the perfect fit by shooting an email (with your name, department and college, and the event you want to participate in) at literaria16@ gmail.com " target="_blank"> http:// gmail.com " target="_blank"> gmail.com
Registrations: 17th August to 5th September.

Get literary, literally.

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur's photo.

Foreign Training and Research Talk presented to you by the International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur for all those aspirants who dream to work abroad in a University on a Project next Summer, this is something you surely aren't missing. We have invited students from the 3rd and 4th Year who interned in various Prestigious Universities to share their experiences and valuable insights about the Foreign Training Process, also to calm your jitters and shackle the myths if any.

Sunday, 28th August, 5pm at V4...Be there!! :)

OPEN IIT - SKETCHING
28 AUGUST, 2PM - 5PM, S-302. :)

Placements is always a hot topic in the IITs.From the lavishing packages offered to the vast number of recruitments, a buzz is always there.
The fresh page in the story of placements is the ban on the 31 firms that went back on job offers by the IIT Placement Committee.The reasons for these companies getting blacklisted include revoking offer letters and delaying joining dates.Most of the barred companies are startups mainly.Healthcare startup Portea medical and Grofers are among the other companies barred.
Here is the link to the full story!
http://timesofindia.in diatimes.com/india/IIT-placement-ban-on-31-firms-that-went-back-on-job-offers/articleshow/53865922.cms?utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=TOI&from=mdr" target="_blank"> http://timesofindia.in dia... " target="_blank"> http://timesofindia.in dia...

105 CL student from IIT-KGP get 700+ IIM calls in CAT'15. Now it's your turn.
Join Career Launcher's Smart CAT Prep course(MRP.7899/-) at Rs.999/- only. Offer only for students studying in IITKGP not for alumnus. Registration on 27th and 28th August at VEGIES. Carry 1 photo & ID card. WhatsApp-9051119190 for more details.
The fruit flavored cup that tricks the brain into thinking your plain water is flavored.

Right from the announcement of the allotted halls to the last date of application for mutual hall swapping, students keep on coaxing, cajoling and persuading others to make them agree for hall swap. Students tend to prefer particular halls, whatever the reasons may be. This hall swapping saga goes on every year as usual. But this year it has been a different story. Mutual hall swapping was announced cancelled by the Hall Management Committee (HMC) a few days after the deadline for submission of forms. The reasons for the same aren’t clear. As per the sources, second-year undergraduate students don’t seem to be so happy with this decision. There has been a growing resentment among them. We as campus media body want to know what does the KGP student community think about this decision. So, we would like you to fill this form and make your voice rise!
https://docs.google.com /forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdaM2dB2fUAAB6QzTGQpJRAFM-Y1AcqZKzGFYnI0LxJmY0Dqw/viewform" target="_blank"> https://docs.google.com /f... " target="_blank"> https://docs.google.com /f...

The IIT Council has started working towards its aims of improving the global status of IITs as a research hub.
The Plans include: "to fill 20 per cent vacancies with foreign faculty, allow off-campus PhD students, 20% international students at undergraduate and postgraduate level, a 1:7 faculty-student ratio and separate capital grants for world class infrastructure."

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur's photo.

Ahoy Freshers!

The time has come to witness the grandeur of yet another facet of the technosapien cosmos. So, hop on, sit back and construe as we delve deeper into this exhilarating spirit of Asia's largest techno-management fest.

Be there at Kalidas Auditorium on 25th August (Thursday) at 8 PM. Surprises await you!

Buy ONE get ONE FREE on 26th AUGUST 2016!!!!!
Also From 1st September 2016, Subway, Nalanda Complex is offering Home Delivery within 3 km Radius.
Subway, IIT Kharagpur

This is one of the better news coming out of this government's higher education strategies.
"Authorities believe that the Rs.60,000 per month fellowship will be incentive enough for graduating B.Tech students to register for a PhD and pursue a career in research in India. "

We don't know if the remuneration is the right amount, but we definitely agree that it is on the right path for a strategy to incentivize research.

Open IIT | Badminton
The tournament wrapped up on August 24 with Sayantan Sarkar (2nd Year) walking away with the gold, as Saket Thavanani (4th Year) had to settle for a silver.
Score: 10-21; 21-11; 21-10
Abhishek Singhal (4th year) was the bronze medallist.
The Scholars' Avenue heartily congratulates the winners and participants alike.

Open IIT Badminton Results

The competition began on 20th August and witnessed shuttlers competing against each other to win the tournament. After an exciting tournament, the standings are:

First Spot - Sayantan Sarkar (RK Hall)
Second Spot - Saket Thavnani (Patel Hall)
Third Spot - Abhishek Singhal (JCB Hall)

Congratulations to the winners!!!

27th August, 4 pm - 7 pm, V1

story: The Scholars' Avenue added an event.
message:
TSA Selections (Day-1), 2016
Date: 11:30PM
Time: 21-08-2016
Veunu: Technology Students Gymkhana , IIT Kharagpur

For the past few days, we have been seeing a growing trend of resentment amongst the students sitting for placements and internships regarding the newly introduced CV module for the auto-generation of Resumes by CDC. As a responsible media body, representing the common voice of student community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, conducted a survey regarding this new CV module and to the no amazement, we got responses from about 400 of the students who will be sitting in the upcoming placements. Here, we present to you the general issues faced by students with detailed infographics on the basis of collected data. Some specific problems addressed by the students have also been put forward in the article. Go on the below link for detailed analysis.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/cv... .php" target="_blank"> http://awaaziitkgp.org/cv... ... " target="_blank"> http://awaaziitkgp.org/cv... ...

भाई की कलाई पर राखी का रेशमी बंधन प्रतिबिम्ब है भाई बहन के बीच के स्नेह और भरोसे का। आज हमारी एक बहन साक्षी मलिक ने रियो ओलंपिक में कांस्य पदक जीतकर जो इतिहास रचा है, हमारी उम्मीद को सत्यता तक पहुँचाया है, उससे हम सब भारतवासियों का सर गर्व से ऊँचा हो गया है तो आइये आज हम सब एकजुट होकर यह स्नेह का धागा उनके नाम करते हैं |
आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से सभी को रक्षाबंधन की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं !!
#Rakhi_4_Sakshi

आई.आई.टी खड़गपुर के सभी विद्यार्थियों एवं शिक्षकगणों को 66वें स्थापना दिवस की ढेरों बधाईयाँ | 65 वर्ष पूर्व आज ही के दिन इस महान संस्थान का शिलान्यास मौलाना अबुल कलाम आज़ाद के हाथों हुआ था और आज ही के दिन उस उम्मीद का भी शिलान्यास हुआ था जो भारत को विज्ञान और तकनीक के माध्यम से दोबारा विश्व गुरु बना सकता है | जवाहरलाल नेहरू की उम्मीदों का हाथ थामे, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर, तीव्र इच्छा-शक्ति के साथ भारत निर्माण के दिशा में उठाया गया पहला कदम था | इसके बाद कई और आई.आई.टी. बनाये गए अर्थात इस दिन को सभी आई.आई.टियों का प्रातिबिंबीक स्थापना दिवस भी माना जा सकता है |
आवाज़, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर इस शुभ अवसर पर उन सभी लोगों को अभिवादन करता है जिन्होंने औपचारिक अथवा अनौपचारिक तौर पर आई.आई.टी. केजीपी के निर्माण में योगदान दिया तथा आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर के सुगम भविष्य की कामना करता है |

Career Development Centre introduced a new system of CV generation for the Internships and Placements 2016-17 this year. Right from the inception, students have been facing many problems with this system and CDC has taken many timely inputs from the students and has made an ample number of changes in the system till date, but it is not up to the mark and the students are still struggling with this method. It has now reached the level of higher complexity. We have decided to take up this issue and we request the Placement Junta to participate in this survey and help us to raise this important issue as the deadline of registration is approaching fast (22nd Aug) . We'll be sending the analysis of this survey to the concerned authorities for the necessary actions.
http://tinyurl.com/hdjalm... 5" target="_blank"> http://tinyurl.com/hdjalm... ... " target="_blank"> http://tinyurl.com/hdjalm... ...

The students of IIT Kharagpur have taken an initiative to celebrate Independence Day with the deprived children of village Soladhar, around 1.5 km from Prem Bazaar gate. Students collected fund themselves and visited villages to celebrate Independence Day with those children.
This independence day, Students of IIT Kharagpur organized a Prabhat Pheri and encouraged villagers to join them. They unfurled flag, sung patriotic songs, cheered them for their performance and gave speeches to motivate to learn and be health conscious. Sweets, Fruits, Biscuits, Notebooks and pens were also distributed afterwards.
This social work has been undertaken by Hemant Singh, Sushant Suman, Ajay Kumar Singh, Deepak Verma, Amit Kumar Das, Tapasya Singh, Vishal Singh, Ashwinikant Tiwari, Yashwant Singh, Jagannath and some other students.
Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur wishes such attempts be taken on a regular basis for the benefits of the society.

Today, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

The institute has passed a new rule restricting bicycles to the newly constructed lanes during class hours. But it has come to the notice of TSA that the cramped lanes often lead to accidents while the roads tend to remain empty for most of the time. Many students also expressed the feeling that the rule curbs their freedom at KGP.

What do KGPians think about this rule and what has been your experience so far?

Tomorrow, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's post.

We welcome Prof B N Singh as the new Dean of HR, IIT Kharagpur. He will look after all matters related to employees other than Faculty. We also welcome Prof Pallab Dasgupta as Dean Sponsored Research & Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) and Prof Suman Chakraborty as the new Associate Dean of SRIC. All of them have take up their roles today. We deeply acknowledge the contributions of Prof Sunando Dasgupta, the outgoing Dean SRIC.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India.
Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpedia.in " target="_blank"> http://www.gyti.techpedia... " target="_blank"> www.gyti.techpedia.in .

Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity:

Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016

You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@sristi.org ,or call at 9099258492.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Vedasheersh Boorla and Somesh Kumar.
message:
Interactive session with Prof. John Mather witnessed an overwhelming response from students and faculty members alike.

We are sincerely thankful to Prof. Somesh Kumar to make the event successful.

A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in... /replay/webcastShow.html?key=vUUIZ1dDHHitrBr" target="_blank"> http://nknvcreplay.nic.in... ... " target="_blank"> http://nknvcreplay.nic.in... ...

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
message: AIESEC IIT Kharagpur in collaboration with Gopali Youth Welfare Society organized a cultural-sports event, ‘Balakalakaar’ for the students of Jagriti Vidya Mandir. JVM is a school where under-privileged students are taught free of cost and is entirely managed by GYWS, a student body in IIT Kharagpur. The event started off with an opening note by the president of AIESEC IIT Kharagpur, Mr. Vinayak Mahbubani in which he thanked the sponsors for the event namely Yes Bank, Syndicate Bank and the alumni network of AIESEC IIT Kharagpur. The drawing competition was the first event in which the students passionately expressed themselves by painting their thoughts on a sheet of paper. Some teachers participated too, and they impressed the judges with their work. The Interns from countries like Portugal, Malaysia, Germany, and Egypt were also present at this event and enthusiastically made some paintings reminiscing on their childhood. The drawing competition was followed by a sports competition which consisted of track field events of children like the balloon bursting, lemon race etc. Balakalakaar ended with a cultural event in which the tiny tots danced and made everyone exclaim at their cuteness. Here are some of the glimpses from the beautiful event.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 4 new photos.
message: AIESEC IIT Kharagpur in collaboration with Gopali Youth Welfare Society organized a social event in JVM, a school run by GYWS. The event symbolized IITians creating a positive impact in the rural India. Here are some pictures from the event 'Balakalakaar'.

The final version of CV module for placements will be opened tomorrow for data filling and CV generation.
Please save the current copies of your CVs (CV1, CV2, CV3) from the ERP for saving the data as the new version may remove some of your old data.
You will be able to enter the data by simply copying from the old CV.

--Chairman, CDC

A Research paper by IIT Kharagpur has been published in the Royal Society of Chemistry Journal, Molecular BioSystems which says that Green Tea can help control Cataract.

The paper was published by Professor Swagata Dasgupta (Department of Chemistry) with her research team . Research scholar Susmitnarayan Chaudhury, the lead author,claims that an oxidant in green tea can prevent and delay the onset of cataract.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Professor Swagata Dasgupta and her entire team!!

http://www.hindustantimes...

The English Academy of St. Xavier's College, Kolkata presents their annual lit-fest Literaria 2016. The following are online events :
1. Meme'sis (the meme making competition)
2. Striptacular (comic-strip creations)
3. Doodlebug (the doodle competition for the free-flowing, felt-tip pen happy)
4. Lens and Lensibility (the photography competition, but we appreciate Austen too)
5. Dress the Digest (calling all graphics geeks to show off their magazine designs)
6. Jump Cut (a film making project and competition for all the cinephiles out there)

So, sign up for the event which you feel is the perfect fit by shooting an email (with your name, department and college, and the event you want to participate in) at literaria16@ gmail.com
Registrations: 17th August to 5th September.

Get literary, literally.

Placements is always a hot topic in the IITs.From the lavishing packages offered to the vast number of recruitments, a buzz is always there.
The fresh page in the story of placements is the ban on the 31 firms that went back on job offers by the IIT Placement Committee.The reasons for these companies getting blacklisted include revoking offer letters and delaying joining dates.Most of the barred companies are startups mainly.Healthcare startup Portea medical and Grofers are among the other companies barred.
Here is the link to the full story!

The fruit flavored cup that tricks the brain into thinking your plain water is flavored.

Right from the announcement of the allotted halls to the last date of application for mutual hall swapping, students keep on coaxing, cajoling and persuading others to make them agree for hall swap. Students tend to prefer particular halls, whatever the reasons may be. This hall swapping saga goes on every year as usual. But this year it has been a different story. Mutual hall swapping was announced cancelled by the Hall Management Committee (HMC) a few days after the deadline for submission of forms. The reasons for the same aren’t clear. As per the sources, second-year undergraduate students don’t seem to be so happy with this decision. There has been a growing resentment among them. We as campus media body want to know what does the KGP student community think about this decision. So, we would like you to fill this form and make your voice rise!
https://docs.google.com/f...

The IIT Council has started working towards its aims of improving the global status of IITs as a research hub.
The Plans include: "to fill 20 per cent vacancies with foreign faculty, allow off-campus PhD students, 20% international students at undergraduate and postgraduate level, a 1:7 faculty-student ratio and separate capital grants for world class infrastructure."

This is one of the better news coming out of this government's higher education strategies.
"Authorities believe that the Rs.60,000 per month fellowship will be incentive enough for graduating B.Tech students to register for a PhD and pursue a career in research in India. "

We don't know if the remuneration is the right amount, but we definitely agree that it is on the right path for a strategy to incentivize research.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added an event.
message:
TSA Selections (Day-1), 2016
Date: 11:30PM
Time: 21-08-2016
Veunu: Technology Students Gymkhana , IIT Kharagpur

For the past few days, we have been seeing a growing trend of resentment amongst the students sitting for placements and internships regarding the newly introduced CV module for the auto-generation of Resumes by CDC. As a responsible media body, representing the common voice of student community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, conducted a survey regarding this new CV module and to the no amazement, we got responses from about 400 of the students who will be sitting in the upcoming placements. Here, we present to you the general issues faced by students with detailed infographics on the basis of collected data. Some specific problems addressed by the students have also been put forward in the article. Go on the below link for detailed analysis.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/cv...

भाई की कलाई पर राखी का रेशमी बंधन प्रतिबिम्ब है भाई बहन के बीच के स्नेह और भरोसे का। आज हमारी एक बहन साक्षी मलिक ने रियो ओलंपिक में कांस्य पदक जीतकर जो इतिहास रचा है, हमारी उम्मीद को सत्यता तक पहुँचाया है, उससे हम सब भारतवासियों का सर गर्व से ऊँचा हो गया है तो आइये आज हम सब एकजुट होकर यह स्नेह का धागा उनके नाम करते हैं |
आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से सभी को रक्षाबंधन की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं !!
#Rakhi_4_Sakshi

आई.आई.टी खड़गपुर के सभी विद्यार्थियों एवं शिक्षकगणों को 66वें स्थापना दिवस की ढेरों बधाईयाँ | 65 वर्ष पूर्व आज ही के दिन इस महान संस्थान का शिलान्यास मौलाना अबुल कलाम आज़ाद के हाथों हुआ था और आज ही के दिन उस उम्मीद का भी शिलान्यास हुआ था जो भारत को विज्ञान और तकनीक के माध्यम से दोबारा विश्व गुरु बना सकता है | जवाहरलाल नेहरू की उम्मीदों का हाथ थामे, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर, तीव्र इच्छा-शक्ति के साथ भारत निर्माण के दिशा में उठाया गया पहला कदम था | इसके बाद कई और आई.आई.टी. बनाये गए अर्थात इस दिन को सभी आई.आई.टियों का प्रातिबिंबीक स्थापना दिवस भी माना जा सकता है |
आवाज़, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर इस शुभ अवसर पर उन सभी लोगों को अभिवादन करता है जिन्होंने औपचारिक अथवा अनौपचारिक तौर पर आई.आई.टी. केजीपी के निर्माण में योगदान दिया तथा आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर के सुगम भविष्य की कामना करता है |

Career Development Centre introduced a new system of CV generation for the Internships and Placements 2016-17 this year. Right from the inception, students have been facing many problems with this system and CDC has taken many timely inputs from the students and has made an ample number of changes in the system till date, but it is not up to the mark and the students are still struggling with this method. It has now reached the level of higher complexity. We have decided to take up this issue and we request the Placement Junta to participate in this survey and help us to raise this important issue as the deadline of registration is approaching fast (22nd Aug) . We'll be sending the analysis of this survey to the concerned authorities for the necessary actions.
http://tinyurl.com/hdjalm...

The students of IIT Kharagpur have taken an initiative to celebrate Independence Day with the deprived children of village Soladhar, around 1.5 km from Prem Bazaar gate. Students collected fund themselves and visited villages to celebrate Independence Day with those children.
This independence day, Students of IIT Kharagpur organized a Prabhat Pheri and encouraged villagers to join them. They unfurled flag, sung patriotic songs, cheered them for their performance and gave speeches to motivate to learn and be health conscious. Sweets, Fruits, Biscuits, Notebooks and pens were also distributed afterwards.
This social work has been undertaken by Hemant Singh, Sushant Suman, Ajay Kumar Singh, Deepak Verma, Amit Kumar Das, Tapasya Singh, Vishal Singh, Ashwinikant Tiwari, Yashwant Singh, Jagannath and some other students.
Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur wishes such attempts be taken on a regular basis for the benefits of the society.

Today, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

The institute has passed a new rule restricting bicycles to the newly constructed lanes during class hours. But it has come to the notice of TSA that the cramped lanes often lead to accidents while the roads tend to remain empty for most of the time. Many students also expressed the feeling that the rule curbs their freedom at KGP.

What do KGPians think about this rule and what has been your experience so far?

Tomorrow, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's post.

We welcome Prof B N Singh as the new Dean of HR, IIT Kharagpur. He will look after all matters related to employees other than Faculty. We also welcome Prof Pallab Dasgupta as Dean Sponsored Research & Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) and Prof Suman Chakraborty as the new Associate Dean of SRIC. All of them have take up their roles today. We deeply acknowledge the contributions of Prof Sunando Dasgupta, the outgoing Dean SRIC.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India.
Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpedia.in .

Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity:

Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016

You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@sristi.org ,or call at 9099258492.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Vedasheersh Boorla and Somesh Kumar.
message:
Interactive session with Prof. John Mather witnessed an overwhelming response from students and faculty members alike.

We are sincerely thankful to Prof. Somesh Kumar to make the event successful.

A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in...

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.
